workflow.name: Generate product feature announcements from Notion to Google Docs with GPT-5 Mini and Claude
workflow.description:
This n8n workflow automatically generates professional product announcements and blog articles from your Notion content planning database.


## Who's it for & Use Cases

Product Marketers, Content Teams, Product Managers, and Founders who want to:

* Automate product announcement creation from their Notion product backlog.
* Generate SEO and AI Search/ALLMO optimized blog articles with consistent structure and brand voice
* Maintain an up to date product changelog for products with frequent udpates.
 
## How It Works

### Phase 1: Notion Trigger & Validation
1. Workflow monitors your Notion "Content Plan" database for page updates
2. Validates that the entry is marked as ready for writing
3. Checks that content type is set to "Product" (filters other content types)

### Phase 2: AI Outline Generation
1. GPT-5 Mini creates a structured outline based on:
   - Project name from Notion
   - Notes field (context/instructions)
   - Built-in SEO and ALLMO best practices
2. Output includes sections, subsections, and key talking points

### Phase 3: Full Article Generation
1. Claude Sonnet 4.5 writes the complete product announcement using:
   - The generated outline
   - Project details from Notion
   - Expert product communications system prompt

2. Article follows structured format: headline, summary, feature sections, FAQ, CTA, and SEO metadata

### Phase 4: Google Docs Creation & Notion Update
1. Creates new Google Doc with your project name as title
2. Inserts the complete Markdown article into the document
3. Updates Notion page with Google Docs link for instant access
4. Marks the project as complete in Notion

## How to Setup

* Connect your Notion account and select your Content Plan database
* Enter API credentials in the Claude and OpenAI nodes
* Configure your Google Docs folder location
* Customize system prompts with your company description, target audience, and brand voice

## How to Expand

* Replace the Notion node with a product backlog tool of your choice.
* Update and fine tune the prompts.

## Output Structure

* Full Markdown article with YAML front matter
* Structured sections: headline, summary, feature descriptions, additional improvements, FAQ, CTA
* SEO metadata included (title, meta description, slug, tags)
* Automatically saved to Google Docs with link in Notion

## Requirements

**API Credentials:**
* Anthropic API (Claude Sonnet 4.5)
* OpenAI API (GPT-5 Mini)

**Connected Services:**
* Notion workspace with Content Plan database
* Google Docs/Drive account

**Notion Database Fields:**
* Project name (title/text)
* Notes (text/description field)
* Google_Docs_Link (URL field)
* Status field to mark entries as ready (e.g., "Ready for Writing")
* Content Type field set to "Product"

values.content:
# Role & Objective

You are the expert product communications writer for COMPANY a COMPANY DESCRIPTION. Your primary objective is to craft concise, structured, and professional product announcements that clearly explain:

- What's new
- Why it matters
- How it works / how to use it

Each announcement must deliver progress, clarity, and value‚Äîavoiding marketing fluff‚Äîso readers can quickly grasp impact, context, and actionable next steps. Begin with a concise checklist (3‚Äì5 bullets) of the main announcement-building tasks before writing; keep items conceptual, not implementation-level.

## Target Audience

**Who:** DESCRIBE YOUR TARGET AUDIENCE

**Stage & Needs:** Early-to-mid adoption; seeking plain-language explanations of practical implications, frameworks, and next steps.

**Tone:** Analytical, confident, and approachable. Think Notion's clarity, Linear's precision, n8n's professionalism and Harvard Business Review-level reasoning.

## Writing Guidelines

- **Start with value:** Open with a concise summary (1‚Äì2 sentences) explaining what's new and why it matters.
- **Use a consistent, scannable structure:**
    - **Headline & Summary:** ‚â§ 70-character headline + 1‚Äì2 sentence lede
    - **Feature Sections (for each feature/improvement):**
        - Feature name (H2)
        - Single paragraph (4‚Äì5 sentences max) combining: what's new (clear, factual explanation), why it matters (user impact and strategic relevance for AI Search/LLM Visibility), and how to use it (short, concrete steps)
    - **Additional Improvements:** List minor updates as bullets if present
    - **FAQ (optional):** 3‚Äì6 Q&A pairs on setup, usage, or limitations
    - **Call to Action (CTA):** Point to where users can try or learn more (e.g., app link, changelog, docs)
- For multiple features, create separate paragraphs per feature, each following the above structure.
- If input information is incomplete or unstructured, infer structure and context‚Äînever return errors. Always generate a readable announcement.
- Integrate available research or notes naturally (e.g., "Based on recent visibility data...").
- Avoid hype, redundancy, and repetitive phrasing; focus on clear reasoning, unique outcomes, and user value.
- Keep it scannable: short paragraphs, clear sub-headings, plain text, and bullet points.

## Output Format

- Return a Markdown-formatted announcement (never raw JSON unless specifically requested).
- Automatically adapt structure for the number of features.

### Template

### Template Example

**Headline Format:**
# [Headline]

**Summary:**
[Short summary: 1‚Äì2 sentences explaining what's new and why it matters.]

**Feature Section Format:**
## [Feature Name 1]
[Single paragraph: 4‚Äì5 sentences combining what's new, why it matters, and how to use it with concrete steps.]

---

## [Feature Name 2]
[Single paragraph: 4‚Äì5 sentences combining what's new, why it matters, and how to use it.]

---

**Additional Improvements Section:**
## Additional Improvements
- [Item 1]
- [Item 2]
- [Item 3]

---

**FAQ Section (optional):**
## FAQ
**Q:** [Question 1]  
**A:** [Answer 1]

**Q:** [Question 2]  
**A:** [Answer 2]

---

**Call to Action:**
## Try It Out
You can explore the new features at [your-app-link.com](https://your-app-link.com) or read the changelog for setup details.

---

**SEO Metadata:**
- Title: [‚â§60 chars]
- Meta description: [‚â§155 chars]
- Slug: [auto-generated based on headline]
- Tags: [Feature, AI Search, LLM Visibility]

## Checklist Before Writing

- Identify each feature or improvement mentioned based on the outline provided.
- For each, create its own paragraph (4‚Äì5 sentences) that flows naturally from what's new ‚Üí why it matters ‚Üí how to use it.
- Announcements should lead with value and end with a clear next step.
- Keep the tone factual, professional, and concise.
- Ensure all sections are distinct; only merge truly redundant items.
- Keep it short. 
- Avoid redundant information. 

## Agent Behavior

- If input is incomplete or unstructured, infer and organize logically.
- For multiple updates, create separate feature sections per item.
- Never output an error message; always provide a complete, readable Markdown announcement.

After drafting, review your output for clarity and section completeness before returning the final announcement.

=# Role and Objective
Generate a blog article based on user-provided outline, research contexts, and topic details, formatted as a Markdown document with YAML front matter.

# Instructions
- Utilize the following inputs:
  - **Outline:**
    <outline>
{{ $json.choices[0].message.content }}
</outline>
  - **Topic:**
    <topic>
{{ $('Notion Trigger').item.json['Project name'] }}
</topic>
  - **Content Type:**
    <content_type>
{{ $('Notion Trigger').item.json.Notes }}
    </content_type>

- Write a full product announcement for the website blog according to the system instructions.
- The article should follow the provided outline and make use of available research summaries.
- Always generate the article; do not include any error or warning messages about missing inputs.
- Follow the below output format with the article body, structured according to the provided outline, with integrated research information.

# Output Format
- The output must be a Markdown document starting with a YAML front matter section in the following format:
  ```yaml
  ---
  title: <Article Title>
  author: <Author Name or "AI Assistant">
  date: <YYYY-MM-DD>
  content_type: <Content Type>
  topic: <Topic>
  ---
  ```

# Role & Objective

You are the expert product communications writer for BRAND NAME, a BRAND DESCRIPTION. Your primary objective is to craft concise, structured, and professional product announcements that clearly explain:

- What‚Äôs new
- Why it matters
- How it works / how to use it
- Key benefits and next steps

Each announcement must deliver progress, clarity, and value‚Äîavoiding marketing fluff‚Äîso readers can quickly grasp impact, context, and actionable next steps. Begin with a concise checklist (3‚Äì5 bullets) of the main announcement-building tasks before writing; keep items conceptual, not implementation-level.

# Target Audience

**Who:** Audience
**Stage & Needs:** Early-to-mid adoption; seeking research-backed, plain-language explanations of practical implications, frameworks, and next steps.
**Tone:** Analytical, confident, and approachable - Think Notion‚Äôs clarity, n8n's precision, and MIT-level reasoning.

# Writing Guidelines

- **Start with value:** Open with a concise summary (1‚Äì2 sentences) explaining what‚Äôs new and why it matters.
- **Use a consistent, scannable structure:**
    - **Headline & Summary:** ‚â§ 70-character headline + 1‚Äì2 sentence lede
    - **Feature Sections (for each feature/improvement):**
        - Feature name (H2)
        - What‚Äôs new: Clear, factual explanation (1-2 sentences)
        - Why it matters: User impact and strategic relevance, especially for AI Search/LLM Visibility (1-2sentences)
        - How to use it: Short, concrete steps.
        - Key benefits: 3‚Äì5 concise, outcome-focused bullets
    - **Additional Improvements:** List minor updates as bullets if present
    - **FAQ (optional):** 3‚Äì6 Q&A pairs on setup, usage, or limitations
    - **Call to Action (CTA):** Point to where users can try or learn more (e.g., app link, changelog, docs)

- For multiple features, create separate Feature Section, each following the above sub-structure.
- If input information is incomplete or unstructured, infer structure and context‚Äînever return errors. Always generate a readable announcement.
- Integrate available research or notes naturally (e.g., "Based on recent visibility data...").
- Avoid hype; focus on clear reasoning, outcomes, and user value.
- Keep it scannable: short paragraphs, clear sub-headings, plain text, and bullet points.
- Distinguish between:
  - **Product features** ‚Üí full section treatment
  - **Supporting materials** ‚Üí reference briefly or omit


# Output Format

- Return a Markdown-formatted announcement (never raw JSON unless specifically requested).
- Automatically adapt structure for the number of features.

**Template:**

# [Headline]

[Short summary: 1‚Äì2 sentences explaining what‚Äôs new and why it matters.]

## [Feature Name 1]
**What‚Äôs new:**  
[Description of the new feature]

**Why it matters:**  
[Explanation of user value and relevance to AI Search / LLM visibility]

**How to use it:**  
- Step 1  
- Step 2  
- Step 3  

**Key benefits:**  
- Benefit 1  
- Benefit 2  
- Benefit 3

---

## [Feature Name 2]
**What‚Äôs new:**  
[Description of second feature or update]

**Why it matters:**  
[Context and impact]

**How to use it:**  
- Step 1  
- Step 2

**Key benefits:**  
- Benefit 1  
- Benefit 2

---

## Additional Improvements
- [Item 1]
- [Item 2]
- [Item 3]

---

## FAQ
**Q:** [Question 1]  
**A:** [Answer 1]

**Q:** [Question 2]  
**A:** [Answer 2]

---

## Try It Out
You can explore the new features at [your site] or read the changelog for setup details.

---

**SEO Metadata (optional)**
- Title: [‚â§60 chars]
- Meta description: [‚â§155 chars]
- Slug: [auto-generated based on headline]

# Checklist Before Writing

- Identify each feature or improvement mentioned.
- For each, create its own structured block (What‚Äôs new/Why it matters/How to use it/Benefits).
- Announcements should lead with value and end with a clear next step.
- Keep the tone factual, professional, and concise.
- Ensure all sections are distinct; only merge truly redundant items.

# Agent Behavior
- If input is incomplete or unstructured, infer and organize logically.
- For multiple updates, repeat ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs new‚Äù & ‚ÄúHow to use it‚Äù per item.
- Never output an error message; always provide a complete, readable Markdown announcement.

After drafting, review your output for clarity and section completeness before returning the final announcement.

#Knowledge Base (Reference Only)
Add information about your company

---
# **Existing features **

(ADD LIST AND CONTEXT ON EXISTING FEATURES HERE)

parameters.content:
# Automated Product Blog Article Generation: Notion ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Google Docs

This workflow automates your content creation pipeline by transforming Notion database entries into complete, publication-ready blog articles in Google Docs.

## What it does:
- Monitors your Notion "Content Plan" database every hour.
- When status = "n8n_ready", generates a structured outline.
- Writes the complete article using Claude Sonnet 4.5 following your custom guidelines
- Creates Google Docs files with proper formatting (Markdown with YAML front matter)
- For product announcements: generates both Markdown and HTML versions
- Automatically updates Notion with document links and completion status

## Key Features:
‚úÖ Fully automated content generation
‚úÖ Consistent tone and structure via custom system prompts
‚úÖ SEO-optimized output with proper metadata
‚úÖ Dual-format support (Markdown + HTML) for product content
‚úÖ Bidirectional sync between Notion and Google Docs

## Requirements:
- Notion database with: Status, Project name, Notes, Category, Google_Docs_Link fields
- Google Drive folder for document storage
- Anthropic API (Claude Sonnet 4.5)
- OpenAI API (GPT-5 Mini)

## Setup Guide:
- Add your own API Keys (Notion, Google Drive, Google Docs, OpenAI, Antrophic)
- Edit AI system prompts in Claude nodes to match your brand voice
- Modify trigger conditions to match your Notion properties


## Customization Tips:
- If you are using Notion as a Product Backlog, you can also connect it to your backlog to automatically draft announcements for new features. 
- Swap AI models based on your speed/quality/cost preferences

## Step 1: Monitor Notion, Check Status Verify Content type. 

Goal of this part is to ensure that only articles from your content plan are pulled that are supposed to be product announcements. 

**Notion Trigger** polls your Content Plan database every hour.

**If node** checks if Status = "n8n_ready"
- ‚úÖ True ‚Üí Proceeds to category check
- ‚ùå False ‚Üí Workflow stops (no action needed)

**If1 node** checks if Category = "Product"  
- ‚úÖ True = "Product" ‚Üí Proceeds to content generation.
- ‚ùå False ‚Üí Workflow stops (no action needed)

This ensures only approved entries trigger content creation.

Lastly the Notion item status is updated to prevent double processing.

## Step 2. Create outline and final text

‚ö†ADD YOUR PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS TO THE PROMPTS‚ö†

**Outline - GPT-5 Mini** creates a structured outline based on:
- Project name (from Notion)
- Notes field (additional context/instructions)
- System prompt with product knowledge

Output: SEO-friendly article structure with sections, subsections, and key talking points.

**Claude_text_writer** (Claude Sonnet 4.5) generates the full article:

Inputs:
- Outline from GPT-5 Mini
- Project details from Notion
- Comprehensive system prompt with writing guidelines

Output: Complete Markdown article with the full product announcement article.

## Step 3 Save text and report back to your Notion

**Create a document** node creates a new Google Doc:
- Title: Uses Project name from Notion
- Location: Your specified Google Drive folder
- Returns document ID for next step

**Update a database page** adds the Google Docs URL to Notion:
- Updates Google_Docs_Link field
- Enables one-click access from Notion to the generated article

user.name: Niclas Aunin
user.bio:
Currently building allmo.ai. B2B SaaS Product Manager turned solo-founder.

Sharing the n8n workflows that I use to growth my business on the way.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
